Package de.turnierverwaltung.model.rating

Class EloRatingSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.turnierverwaltung.model.rating.EloRatingSystem
  • public class EloRatingSystem
extends Object
    JOGRE's implementation of the ELO rating system. The following is an example of how to use the Elo Rating System. EloRatingSystem elo = new EloRatingSystem(); int userRating = 1600; int opponentRating = 1650; int newUserRating = elo.getNewRating(userRating, opponentRating, WIN); int newOpponentRating = elo.getNewRating(opponentRating, userRating, LOSS);
    Author:
    Garrett Lehman (gman)

      • ELO_K_FACTOR_NEWBIE

        public static final double ELO_K_FACTOR_NEWBIE
        Default ELO, K is the development coefficient. (FIDE System) K = 30 for a player new to the rating list until he has completed events with a total of at least 30 games. K = 20 for RAPID and BLITZ ratings all players. K = 15 as long as a player`s rating remains under 2400. K = 10 once a player`s published rating has reached 2400, and he has also completed events with a total of at least 30 games. Thereafter it remains permanently at 10.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getNewRating

        public int getNewRating​(int rating,
                        int opponentRating,
                        double score,
                        boolean isNewbie)
        Get new rating.
        Parameters:
        rating - Rating of either the current player or the average of the current team.
        opponentRating - Rating of either the opponent player or the average of the opponent team or teams.
        score - Score: 0=Loss 0.5=Draw 1.0=Win
        gameMode - This param for K Factor: gameMode=1 - Blitz mode gameMode=0 - Standart game mode
        isNewbie - for a player new to the rating list until he has completed events with a total of at least 30 games. true if <=30, false if > 30
        Returns:
        the new rating
